semantic_title: Coding of Injuries - General Principles and Sequencing Rules
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 19. Chapter 19: Injury, poisoning, and certain other consequences of external causes > b. Coding of Injuries

content.full_text: When coding injuries, assign separate codes for each injury unless a combination code is provided, in which case the combination code is assigned. Codes from category T07, Unspecified multiple injuries should not be assigned in the inpatient setting unless information for a more specific code is not available. Traumatic injury codes (S00-T14.9) are not to be used for normal, healing surgical wounds or to identify complications of surgical wounds. The code for the most serious injury, as determined by the provider and the focus of treatment, is sequenced first. Superficial injuries such as abrasions or contusions are not coded when associated with more severe injuries of the same site. When a primary injury results in minor damage to peripheral nerves or blood vessels, the primary injury is sequenced first with additional code(s) for injuries to nerves and spinal cord (such as category S04), and/or injury to blood vessels (such as category S15). detailed_rules.rule_text: When coding injuries, assign separate codes for each injury unless a combination code is provided, in which case the combination code is assigned (Evidence: pg no: 78, L93)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Codes from category T07, Unspecified multiple injuries should not be assigned in the inpatient setting unless information for a more specific code is not available (Evidence: pg no: 78, L93-L95)
detailed_rules.explanation: T07 codes are discouraged in inpatient settings where more specific documentation should be available (Evidence: pg no: 78, L93-L95)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Traumatic injury codes (S00-T14.9) are not to be used for normal, healing surgical wounds or to identify complications of surgical wounds (Evidence: pg no: 78, L95-L96)
detailed_rules.explanation: Injury codes are only for traumatic injuries, not surgical procedures or their complications (Evidence: pg no: 78, L95-L96)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The code for the most serious injury, as determined by the provider and the focus of treatment, is sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 78, L97)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Superficial injuries such as abrasions or contusions are not coded when associated with more severe injuries of the same site (Evidence: pg no: 78, L99)
detailed_rules.explanation: Minor superficial injuries are not coded separately when more severe injuries exist at the same anatomical site (Evidence: pg no: 78, L99)
